title: Kurt Vonnegut's Story Shapes
description: A fast breakdown of Kurt Vonnegut's Story Shapes for builders.

hook.text: Kurt Vonnegut drew story arcs on a chalkboard â€” 'Man in Hole,' 'Boy Meets Girl,' 'Cinderella.' The audience loved it.

buildup.text: He mapped stories on two axes: fortune (good to bad) and time (beginning to end). Each story has a shape.

discovery.text: Researchers at UVM analyzed 1,700 stories with AI and found six dominant emotional arcs â€” Vonnegut was right.

twist.text: The most popular shape? 'Rags to riches' (rise) and 'Man in hole' (fall-rise). We crave upward trajectories.

climax.text: Vonnegut's insight: story structure isn't literary theory. It's emotional engineering with predictable shapes.

punchline.text: Every story is a shape. The shape determines how it feels.
